channel.title: Router ip issues
channel.description:
hi i was trying to start myself a server and i was following the ultimate server guide and when i got to this point
Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router.
i found the connection kept timing out my friend thinks that that means it wont be supported or something does anyone know why it keeps timing out? or anyway how i can avoid this?[br][size=1]Posted on: June 10, 2007, 11:26:34 PM[/size][hr]any feedback would be nice...

item.title: Router ip issues
item.dc:creator: @fatcat2248 fatcat2248
item.description:
@fatcat2248 wrote:

what it meens is u need to make a rule in your router so people can connect to u.
this is done by going to you router (normally by typing 192.168.1.1) into internet explorer.
then going to virtual servers and making a rule for the port 43594 (DEFAULT) then putting in your router ip next to it it will be 192.168.1.2 or something like that. then it should work

as for you steve? if u did that wifout portforwarding then ur routers filewall must suck unless u are doing DMZ

gd luck
-fatcat-

Read full topic
